If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
PS M:\GitHub\PowerShell\src\powershell-win-core\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\win7-x64\publish> md Test


    Directory: M:\GitHub\PowerShell\src\powershell-win-core\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\win7-x64\publish


Mode                LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                -------------         ------ ----
d-----       22.08.2018     23:08                Test


PS M:\GitHub\PowerShell\src\powershell-win-core\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\win7-x64\publish> cd .\Test\
PS M:\GitHub\PowerShell\src\powershell-win-core\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\win7-x64\publish\Test> copy C:\Windows\notepad.exe pwsh.exe
PS M:\GitHub\PowerShell\src\powershell-win-core\bin\Debug\netcoreapp2.1\win7-x64\publish\Test> start ..\pwsh.exe
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

Proper icon to be used.

Actual behavior
---------------

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17184058/44488887-96b12e00-a662-11e8-8479-f80362652e06.png)

----------------

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0-rc.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0-rc.1-7-g7b790f2f618c37d46518d2c4c95c4e47c46c6924
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.body:
@PetSerAl I can repro this with just `cmd.exe` so I don't think this is a PowerShell issue. It is probably by design in Windows. I don't like the behavior either.

```batch
C:\WINDOWS\system32>mkdir test

C:\Windows\System32>cd test

C:\Windows\System32\test>copy ..\notepad.exe cmd.exe
        1 file(s) copied.

C:\Windows\System32\test>dir
 Volume in drive C has no label.
 Volume Serial Number is BA92-0884

 Directory of C:\Windows\System32\test

08/22/2018  08:12 PM    <DIR>          .
08/22/2018  08:12 PM    <DIR>          ..
04/11/2018  07:34 PM           245,760 cmd.exe
               1 File(s)        245,760 bytes
               2 Dir(s)  23,496,794,112 bytes free

C:\Windows\System32\test>start ..\cmd.exe
```

![repro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14023826/44497633-87bd8200-a648-11e8-8f6a-019e3e2779d0.png)

title: pwsh.exe set console icon from first pwsh.exe it finds, but not from its own executable.
